titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Aleksei Aleksandrovich Fon-Lampe Papers, 1918-1926
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Correspondence, reports, memoranda, orders, newsletters, clippings, leaflets, maps, pamphlets, and printed matter, relating to operations of the offices of the Russian Military Agent in Germany and the Russian Military Representative to Hungary, Russian counterrevolutionary activities, political events in Russia, and activities of Russian civilians and military personnel in Europe. Includes the office files of the delegation of the Russian Society of the Red Cross for Relief to Prisoners of War, 1919-1922.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Aleksei Aleksandrovich Fon-Lampe Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1928.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

Head of local unit of French Red Cross, Lake Constance

did.unittitle: Office File Of The Russian Military Agent In Germany, 1918-1926

scopecontent.p: Announcements, circulars, correspondence, financial statements and receipts, information bulletins, memoranda, notes, orders, reports and staff lists, arranged as listed. Constitutes the files of General Nikolai A. Monkewitz (June-August 1919); Colonel Alexander F. Brant (mid-1919 to early 1920); Lieutenant-General Ivan A. Holmsen (early 1920 to mid-1922); and Colonel Alexei A. von Lampe (mid-1922 to 1926). Includes letters and orders signed by Generals Nikolai N. Yudenitch, A. E. Denikin, P. N. Wrangel, P. A. Kusonskii, E. K. Miller, and P. N. Shatilov.

did.unittitle: Office File of the Russian Military Representative to the Government of Hungary, 1921-1926

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, financial statements, orders, and staff lists, arranged as listed. con-stitutes the files of Esaul Vladimir A. Ilawaisky, Assistant To The Military Representative to the Government of Hungary, and Colonel Alexei A. Von Lampe, who simultaneously held the posts of Military Agent in Germany and mIlitary Representative To The Government Of Hungary. Includes letters and orders signed by Generals P A. Kusonskii, E. K. Miller, and I. A. Holmsen.

did.unittitle: Office File of the Delegation of the Russian Society Of The Red Cross for Relief to Prisoners-of-War, 1919-1922

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, arranged alphabetically by last name of correspondent or name of organization. General Dmitri N. Potosky was chief of the delegation from January to May 1919, after which its functions were assumed by the Russian Military Mission in Germany.
Letters, newspaper clippings, reports, communiques, pamphlets, leaflets, maps, lists, newsletters, and information bulletins, arranged alphabetically by subject.
